title: AI assistants make widespread errors about the news, new research shows
description: The international research studies 3,000 responses to questions about the news from leading artificial intelligence assistants
content:
GENEVA, Switzerland – Leading AI assistants misrepresent news content in nearly half their responses, according to new research published on Wednesday, October 22, by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and the BBC.
The international research studi... [2356 chars]

title: Taiwan Launches Asia Innovation Capital Initiative to Become AI Hub
description: TAIPEI, Oct. 22, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- The Financial Supervisory Commission (FSC), in collaboration with the Taiwan Stock Exchange (TWSE) and Taipei Exchange (TPEx), has launched the Asia Innovation Capital initiative, a strategic program led by the FSC to strengthen Taiwan's capital markets and establish the market as a regional hub for innovation and artificial intelligence.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella earns almost a whopping $100 million in FY25 - What fueled the hike?
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's compensation rose to $96.5 million for fiscal 2025, the highest since he became CEO over a decade ago. The increase is attributed to Microsoft's advancements in artificial intelligence, with 90% of his pay in company shares.
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s compensation increased to $96.5 million for fiscal 2025, marking his highest earnings since taking on the role over ten years ago, with the board attributing the boost to the company’s advancements in artificial intellig... [774 chars]

title: US right-wing media figures, tech pioneers call for superintelligent AI ban
description: (Reuters) -A group including right-wing U.S. media personalities Steve Bannon and Glenn Beck has signed a statement calling for a ban on developing superintelligent artificial intelligence until the public demands it and science paves a safe way forward, according to the non-profit organizers of the initiative.

title: Prince Harry, Geoffrey Hinton Call for Ban on AI Superintelligence
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Steve Bannon and artificial intelligence pioneer Geoffrey Hinton are part of a group calling for a ban on AI superintelligence until that technology can be deployed safely.

title: Netflix ‘all in’ on leveraging AI in its streaming platform
description: Netflix is “all in” on leveraging generative artificial intelligence on its streaming platform, the company said.
content:
Netflix is "all in" on leveraging generative artificial intelligence on its streaming platform, according to the company, as AI continues to make its way into mainstream entertainment.
